intro: Calystegia stebbinsii, commonly known as the Stebbins' morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its trumpet-shaped, pale yellow to white flowers. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces hairy, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and along stream banks. Its rapid growth and sprawling habit make it both a notable ornamental and a potential invasive species in certain regions.
